Let me summarize the task and data provided:

Task: Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks from a markdown document, removes code fences and joins the code blocks together with newlines. Return a String.

Data: A Markdown document with Julia language code blocks (`md`).

Here's my attempt at solving it: ðŸ¤”

```julia-repl
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Extract all the code blocks using a regular expression
    regex = r"```julia\n(.*?)```"ms
    codeblocks = matchall(regex, md)
    
    if length(codeblocks) > 0
        # Remove code fences and join with newlines
        output = replace.(codeblocks, "```"=>"")
        output_str = join(output, "\n")
        
        return output_str
    else
        error("No Julia code blocks found in the Markdown document!")
    end
end
```

Please note that this function assumes all code blocks are correctly formatted and marked with ```julia. If a different language is used (e.g., ```python), it will not be extracted. Also, if there are no Julia code blocks in the Markdown document, an error will be thrown. ðŸš¨
